content:
Nice clash. Only thing I'd suggest is adding a Constraint saying:
There will never be negative integers in the string.

I got this in Fastest mode and submitted really fast by ensuring I only summed numbers that existed as words with no non-digit characters, but then I realised after submitting that I would have failed any validator that had a negative number e.g. "I think -23 plus 24 equals 1" - my code would output 25 instead of 2.

It would be good to clarify that clashers don't need to worry about negative integers. :)

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice, simple, puzzle that's easy to understand

How can I understand that you mean only integer numbers and not other numbers?

For example, from your Goal statement, I could assume that maybe one of the valid test is like this:

"The recipe for cookie require 2 eggs and 1.5 kg sugar."

And then I could spend time on int(2+1.5) and write longer solution in fastest mode, because short solution "1.5".isdigit() => False may seem not to work potentially (when I do not know if number means integer).

1.5 is also number. If you mean only integer numbers, then you can either change word "numbers" to "integers" in the Goal statement or indicate in the Constraints section that numbers are integers. Otherwise, if you mean any numbers including floats, then add other test cases reflecting that and update solution to include float numbers.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Interesting test

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Its interesting

Goal section
* Suggest to change "Now give you" to "Given".

Cases
* The second pair of test and validator are the same. Please revise them so that they are similar but remain different.

Stub generator
* Please add a write statement.

Thanks.
This is my first contribution! It might not be perfect, but if you like it, please give me your support! Thank you!
